sentences.sidenote: Fangorn calls order. It is morning on 30 February, T.A. 3019.
sentences.english: Fangorn calls the Entmoot to order.
I, Fangorn, have met two creatures not in the old lists. They are named Peregrin and Meriadoc. They call themselves hobbits.

sentences.sidenote: Hobbits are added to the old lists.
sentences.english: Let us add hobbits to the old lists.

sentences.sidenote: Fangorn excuses himself to care for the hobbits.
sentences.english: The hobbits need my care. I will return.

sentences.sidenote: Fladrif (Skinbark) starts to describe the suffering of the trees.
sentences.english: Fladrif reports on the suffering of the trees.

sentences.sidenote: We call out the names of the dead (many names omitted for space).
sentences.english: AA, AB, AC, AD, AE, AF, AG, AH, AI, AJ, AK.

sentences.sidenote: The Entmoot mourns together. The mourning goes on through the evening and the night.
sentences.english: With sorrow we remember our losses.

sentences.sidenote: The Entmoot continues its lament. It is morning on 1 March, T.A. 3019
sentences.english: Let us remember with joy their lives.

sentences.sidenote: Finglas (Leaflock) urges restraint. It is afternoon on 1 March, T.A. 3019.
sentences.english: Finglas urges restraint, avoidance of hastiness. Remember Fimbrethil.

sentences.sidenote: Fladrif declares the Entmoot must react quickly.
sentences.english: Fladrif declares the Entmoot must react quickly.

sentences.sidenote: The Ent known as Beechbone concurs.
Fangorn says he must act, even if it means never seeing Fimbrethil again.
sentences.english: Act says Fangorn, despite love for Fimbrethil.

sentences.sidenote: Fangorn recommends marching on Orthanc with the Hourns.
sentences.english: March to Orthanc with the Hourns!

sentences.sidenote: The Entmoot agrees to march on Orthanc. It is morning on 2 March, T.A. 3019.
sentences.english: We march to our doom if need be!

sentences.sidenote: The Entmoot start their march. It is afternoon on 2 March, T.A. 3019.
